item.title: SWIFT Network Abused Again By Internet Criminals
item.description:
SWIFT Network Abused Again By Internet Criminals

For the second time in a few months, the SWIFT payment network has come under attack from hackers. To make matters even worse, a different bank was involved in the process this time, and money has been stolen this time as well.

item.title: Taiwanese Bitcoin Conman Arrested on Multiple Charges
item.description:
Taiwanese Bitcoin Conman Arrested on Multiple Charges

In a report coming out of Taiwan, an individual who founded and ran a bitcoin company has been arrested on charges of fraud, breach of trust and document forgery after allegedly causing losses to 49 customers in a month.

item.title: Privacy: what if I run my Bitcoin Core for a first time without configuring it to use tor?
item.description:
Privacy: what if I run my Bitcoin Core for a first time without configuring it to use tor?

I'm very new to bitcoin. Sorry for maybe silly or paranoid questions, but: Do I compromise myself in any ways when I first time run the official Bitcoin Core client for downloading all transaction...

item.title: Can I Protect My Bitcoin Web Wallet?
item.description:
Can I Protect My Bitcoin Web Wallet?

A lot of Bitcoin enthusiasts prefer to store their funds in a web wallet which they do not fully control. Although there is a clear demand for such services, Bitcoin users need to be aware that, despite precautions, there is no guarantee web wallets will be safe forever.

item.title: Palantir Denies Ownership Of Quantum Computing-Power Bitcoin Mining Company
item.description:
Palantir Denies Ownership Of Quantum Computing-Power Bitcoin Mining Company

A mysterious bitcoin mining company based in Hong Kong, which is promising to "infuse" the industry with the power of quantum computing, claimed earlier this week it is owned by big data company Palantir Technologies, the secretive data analytics company co-founded by venture capitalist and PayPal co-founder Peter Thiel.

item.title: BitPagos Is Making Waves at Disrupt 2016 - Bitcoin News
item.description:
BitPagos Is Making Waves at Disrupt 2016 - Bitcoin News

The startup Also read: New Yorkers Tout Blockchain at Libertarian Party Convention BitPagos is making waves at the TechCrunch Disrupt 2016 event held in New York. The conference at the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal has highlighted the company's achievements to enable credit within the online blockchain industry.

item.title: Digital Bitcoin Company's Chairman Arrested on Fraud Charges
item.description:
Digital Bitcoin Company's Chairman Arrested on Fraud Charges

It is not the first time Digital Bitcoin Company chairman Ho gets into troubled waters with law enforcement, as he falsely claimed Bitcoin investors wanted to buy cryptocurrency at a premium price. Bitcoin has attracted the attention of law enforcement agencies all over the world in recent years, yet some people still use cryptocurrency as a way to commit fraud.

item.title: Top 10 Myths About Bitcoin
item.description:
Top 10 Myths About Bitcoin

Although Bitcoin has been around for more than seven years now, there are still plenty of myths about this technology percolating among the general public and the mainstream press. Bitcoin is sometimes a difficult subject to grasp because it requires a basic understanding of many different areas of study such as cryptography, economics and computer science.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: 5/13/2016
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Analysis: 5/13/2016

Bitcoin has finished its downward rebound wave. The price has stopped at a key level, where the market is going to choose a direction. A key resistance line of $454 is responsible for the structure of the downward trend. Bitcoin's price has stopped at that level, as it's dominated by active bears.

item.title: Korea Exchange Talks Top-Down Approach to Blockchain Innovation - CoinDesk
item.description:
Korea Exchange Talks Top-Down Approach to Blockchain Innovation - CoinDesk

Though major stock exchanges in London and New York have garnered the lion's share of major media headlines, their peers internationally are moving at a similar pace to investigate the potential of blockchain tech.
